description: This course surveys standard topics in the study of algorithms, with an emphasis on complexity analysis and implementation experience. Topics include asymptotic analysis, searching and sorting, divide and conquer, basic graph algorithms, greedy algorithms, dynamic programming, and NP-complete problems. Offered each semester. Prerequisites: MATH 234 and CSCI 251, or consent of the instructor.
name: Analysis of Algorithms
notes: This course is open to a limited-number of rising juniors.
prerequisites: Prerequisites: MATH 234 and CSCI 251, or consent of the instructor.
